column2: Evidence of current government-operated/sponsored AQ monitoring
column3: Evidence of ad hoc studies by government
column4: AQ monitoring existed in the past, but not currently
column5: A: Physical Units: Data are shared in physical units, as opposed to a country- (or organization-) specific Air Quality Index, Air Pollution Index, or AQI-like quantities.
column6: B: Station-Specific Coordinates: Data are provided at the most transparent geographic scale at which they are collected (station-scale) and with location metadata in the form of readily available geographic coordinates.
column7: C: Timely Fine-Scale Temporal Information: Data are provided at daily or sub-daily levels in near real time of in a timely manner with time-of-collection stamps and averaging periods.
column8: D: Programmatic Access:  Data and metadata as defined in the preceding criteria are publicly accessible in a programmatic or machine-readable format.
